text: One of those sections is on giving away your Lego, finding joy in the other things of building a team, passing on your experience, helping other people do great writing or great product building or great engineering.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny asks Cameron about the culture at Canva. Cameron describes a specific cultural principle called 'giving away your Lego', which emphasizes the importance of sharing knowledge and responsibilities within the team. This concept encourages employees to find fulfillment in mentoring others and contributing to collective success rather than clinging to individual tasks.
text_ko: 그 섹션 중 하나는 레고를 나누는 것에 대한 거예요. 팀을 만드는 다른 즐거움을 찾고, 자신의 경험을 나누고, 다른 사람들이 훌륭한 글쓰기나 제품 개발, 엔지니어링을 할 수 있도록 도와주는 거죠.
text_zh: 其中一个部分是关于分享你的乐趣，发掘团队建设中的其他乐趣，传承你的经验，帮助他人进行优秀的写作、卓越的产品开发或出色的工程。
text_es: Una de esas secciones trata sobre compartir tus conocimientos, encontrar satisfacción en otros aspectos de construir un equipo, transmitir tu experiencia y ayudar a otras personas a lograr una excelente escritura, desarrollo de productos o ingeniería.
key_sentence: Find joy in giving away your Lego and building a team.

text: We don't really have managers, but everyone at Canva has a coach. They're constantly working with you to look at your skills, but also when it might be time to move on to the next level.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny inquires about the coaching structure at Canva. Cameron explains that instead of traditional managers, Canva employs a coaching model where each employee has a coach to help them assess their skills and identify opportunities for advancement. This approach fosters personal and professional growth, ensuring that employees have support as they navigate their careers.
vocabulary_highlights: move on to the next level
text_ko: 우리는 사실 매니저가 없고, 대신 모든 사람이 코치를 가지고 있어요. 코치들은 여러분의 스킬을 살펴보면서, 다음 단계로 나아갈 때가 언제인지도 함께 고민해줘요.
text_zh: 我们在Canva并没有传统意义上的经理，但每个人都有一个教练。他们会不断与你合作，关注你的技能发展，同时也帮助你判断何时该迈向下一个阶段。
text_es: En Canva no tenemos gerentes, pero todos cuentan con un coach. Ellos están constantemente trabajando contigo para evaluar tus habilidades y también para determinar cuándo es el momento de avanzar al siguiente nivel.
key_sentence: Canva's coaching model helps you move on to the next level.

text: I think there's probably a few different stories that would resonate with your audience because there's like business kind of stories of how the actual company's tracking. There's product stories of stuff we launched that didn't go anywhere.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny asks Cameron about moments of struggle within Canva's success narrative. Cameron highlights the importance of sharing both business and product stories, acknowledging that while the company has seen significant achievements, there have also been instances of failure and lessons learned. This nuanced view demonstrates that success is often accompanied by challenges.
text_ko: 아마 여러분의 청중과 공감할 수 있는 여러 가지 이야기가 있을 것 같아요. 실제 회사의 진행 상황에 대한 비즈니스 이야기들도 있고, 우리가 출시했지만 별로 반응이 없었던 제품 이야기들도 있거든요.
text_zh: 我认为有几种不同的故事可以引起你们受众的共鸣，因为有关于公司运营的商业故事，还有关于我们推出但没有取得成功的产品故事。
text_es: Creo que probablemente hay varias historias diferentes que resonarían con tu audiencia, ya que hay historias relacionadas con el negocio sobre cómo está avanzando la empresa. También hay historias de productos sobre lanzamientos que no tuvieron éxito.
key_sentence: Different stories resonate with your audience, including product stories.

text: Part of being in a startup is scaling, when you're scaling from zero users to a million to a hundred million, and when you're scaling from three founders to 10 employees to 100 employees to 4,000 employees.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny asks Cameron about the cultural concept of 'giving away your Lego'. Cameron explains that as startups grow, the need for flexibility and collaboration increases. He emphasizes that scaling involves not only expanding user numbers but also adapting internal processes and team dynamics to support this growth.
text_ko: 스타트업에서 일하는 건 사용자 수를 제로에서 백만, 백만에서 천만으로 늘리는 과정이기도 해요. 그리고 창립자가 세 명에서 열 명, 열 명에서 백 명, 백 명에서 사천 명으로 늘어나는 것도 마찬가지고요.
text_zh: 创业的一部分就是扩展，从零用户到一百万，再到一亿；从三位创始人到十名员工，再到一百名员工，最后到四千名员工。
text_es: Parte de estar en una startup es escalar; cuando pasas de cero usuarios a un millón, luego a cien millones, y cuando escalas de tres fundadores a 10 empleados, luego a 100 empleados y finalmente a 4,000 empleados.
key_sentence: Scaling involves internal processes from zero to millions of users.

text: We've always been an incredibly product-led company. We always think first and foremost about the product.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny discusses the focus of Canva's board meetings, which prioritize product updates over financials. Cameron asserts that Canva's identity as a product-led company drives their decision-making process and strategic planning. This commitment to product excellence is integral to their success and aligns with their mission to create valuable experiences for users.
text_ko: 우리는 항상 제품 중심의 회사였어요. 항상 제품에 대해 가장 먼저 생각해요.
text_zh: 我们一直是一家以产品为导向的公司。我们始终将产品放在首位。
text_es: Siempre hemos sido una empresa increíblemente enfocada en el producto. Siempre pensamos, ante todo, en el producto.
key_sentence: We are a product-led company, thinking first and foremost about the product.

text: Freemium for us wasn't so much a growth strategy or a monetization strategy as much as it spoke to our core mission of empowering the world to design.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny asks about Canva's freemium strategy. Cameron clarifies that their freemium model aligns with their mission to democratize design rather than solely serving as a growth tactic. By making their tools accessible to a broader audience, Canva enhances its brand value and encourages widespread use of its platform.
text_ko: 프리미엄 모델(freemium)은 우리에게 성장 전략이나 수익화 전략이라기보다는, 세상을 디자인할 수 있도록 돕는 우리의 핵심 미션을 잘 보여주는 거였어요.
text_zh: 对我们来说，Freemium 并不是一种增长策略或盈利策略，而是体现了我们赋能全球设计的核心使命。
text_es: Para nosotros, el modelo freemium no fue tanto una estrategia de crecimiento o de monetización, sino que reflejó nuestra misión fundamental de empoderar al mundo para diseñar.
key_sentence: The freemium model helps us democratize design, aligning with our core mission.

text: We don't need to create an LLM because it's a commodity thing now. And there's a bunch of providers who can do it way better and have way more resources to do it with than you do.
speaker: Cameron Adams
context: Lenny raises the topic of AI integration at Canva. Cameron explains that rather than developing their own large language models (LLMs), they focus on leveraging partnerships with established AI providers. This strategic decision allows Canva to utilize advanced technology without the significant resource investment, emphasizing the importance of collaboration in tech development.
text_ko: 이제 LLM을 만들 필요 없어요. 그건 이미 일반화된 거라서, 훨씬 더 잘하고 자원도 많은 공급자들이 많거든요.
text_zh: 我们不需要再开发大型语言模型（LLM），因为这已经成为一种商品化的产品。现在有很多供应商能够做得更好，并且拥有比我们更多的资源。
text_es: No necesitamos crear un LLM (modelo de lenguaje grande) porque ahora es algo común. Hay muchos proveedores que pueden hacerlo mucho mejor y cuentan con muchos más recursos para lograrlo que nosotros.
key_sentence: LLMs are a commodity; better providers have more resources than you.
